Text: List of poisonous plants:  Some plants have physical defenses such as thorns, spines and prickles, but by far the most common type of protection is chemical.

Text: List of poisonous plants:  Tannin, for example, is a defensive compound that emerged relatively early in the evolutionary history of plants, while more complex molecules such as polyacetylenes are found in younger groups of plants such as the Asterales.

Text: List of poisonous plants:  Many of the known plant defense compounds primarily defend against consumption by insects, though other animals, including humans, that consume such plants may also experience negative effects, ranging from mild discomfort to death.
